description: The Shramashakthi Special Womenâ€™s Scheme in Karnataka provides loans and subsidies for economic empowerment of widowed, divorced, or unmarried minority women, enabling them to start self-employment ventures.

benefits.loan_amount: Up to Rs. 2 Lakhs for business setup
benefits.subsidy: 50% subsidy on loan amount, up to Rs. 1 Lakh

gender_criteria: Widowed, divorced, or unmarried minority women aged 18-50 years
community_criteria: Must belong to a minority community (Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Jain, Buddhist, Parsi)
residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Karnataka

eligible_activities: Setting up self-employment ventures in services, retail, or handicrafts
Purchase of equipment or raw materials

steps: Obtain the application form from the Karnataka Minority Development Corporation
Submit a detailed business plan with the application
Attach required documents, including minority certificate and residency proof
Applications are reviewed by the corporation
Approved applicants receive loans and subsidies
application_process.note: Applicants must secure a bank loan to avail subsidy

special_notes: The subsidy is linked to bank loans
Priority is given to economically disadvantaged women
